title: This List of Reasons For Keeping People In Asylums In the 1800s Is…Well, Insane
text:
Over 3 million people just like you 'Like' us » Like it? Share it! 124 Shares The Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum located in Weston, West Virginia served as a sanctuary for the mentally ill in the mid-1800s. 
Its 666 acres contained a working farm, dairy, and cemetery, and it officially closed in 1994. 
So what did it take to get in? This is a list of “reasons for admission," and let's just say, it doesn't take much.
